comments:

>CTRL+SHIFT+T (x2) 
The second Ctrl+Shift is a no-op.

Which font(s) are you using (might be related to bug 4564).

The exception originates from fSeparatorWidth being 0.
  (GC gc)
  fSeparatorWidth= gc.getAdvanceWidth('-');

Question to SWT: Is this to be expected?

I'm not sure about the font.  If I dig into the font style control (CDE) I get a default of Medium:

-dt-interface system-medium-r-normal-m sans-17-170-72-72-p-97-iso8859-1

I also have a few xterms open from my linux box, which opened with a message:
xterm:  unable to open font "-misc-fixed-medium-r-semicondensed--13-120-75-75-c-60-iso10646-1", trying "fixed"....

but the xterms and all of my other apps continue to work.

PW
As far as I know, GC.getAdvanceWidth() should never return zero.
